idinfo.useconst: The Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) assumes no responsibility for errors, omissions, or any liability for damages resulting from use of any of the data. AMC makes no representations or warranties of any kind, express or implied, about the completeness, accuracy, or reliability with respect to the data for any purpose. Any reliance placed on such information is strictly at the users own risk.
idinfo.datacred: A project of the Appalachian Mountain Club in collaboration with the Pennsylvania Committee of the Highlands Coalition.

procstep.procdesc: Thirty-meter National Land Cover Dataset pixels relating to forests, wetlands, and open water were identified and reclassified to equal the same value. All contiguous pixels totaling less than fifty Hectares on the ground were removed. A buffer was built around roads removing a 200 meters wide path from primary roads, and a 100 meters wide path around secondary roads. Multipart shapes were converted onto a single part, and all shapes were then dissolved onto one shape. The aggregate tool in Spatial Analyst was used with the following settings: Cell size: 10 Aggregation method:Minimum Expand Extent? Yes Use no value cells? Yes Polygons greater than 20 hectares are selected and combined with Natural Land Trust Smart Cinservation data to create strongholds. The USDA Forest Service highlands boundary was used to seperate the PA highlands into two regions. The highest ten percent of stronghold lands were extracted in the area defined by the Forest Service boundary. The highest five percent of stronghold lands were wxtracted in the remaining area, due to the high averages produced by Michaux State Forest. The two sets of data were comined, and a nearest neighbor analysis of 1000 meters was performed.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
